alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 10:53PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Weber... southeastern Box Elder and northern Davis Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1052 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway to near Syracuse. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated and mesonet confirmed. These storms have a history of producing wind gusts around 50 mph. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Layton, Hill Air Force Base, Roy, Clearfield, Syracuse, Clinton, South Ogden, Washington Terrace, Riverdale, Hooper, South Weber, Marriott-Slaterville, Uintah, Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway, Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway, West Haven, West Point, Farr West and Plain City. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on the Great Salt Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 330 and 346. Interstate 84 between mile markers 82 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front
